entry.title: [Passwords] Convert sharing public key to base64
entry.content:
Bytes from x25519_public_key proto may not match valid utf-8 characters.

Conversion to Base64 prevents further errors while converting string to

different types. Also, this helps with debugging by verifying the public keys from `chrome.passwordsPrivate.fetchFamilyMembers` match with ones

in chrome://sync-internals.

entry.title: Fix dangling ExperimentalAsh pointers [4/N]
entry.content:
ExperimentalAsh pointers are not (yet) subject to MiraclePtr and the

DanglingPointerDetector.



In order to enable them, we need to fix or annotate every dangling

pointer. There is one in this test. The pointer should have been a

std::unique_ptr, but couldn't because the object destructor is private.



This patch uses raw_ptr::ExtractAsDangling() to clear the pointer

when deleting the object. It avoids the pointer to be dangling

after the delete instruction. Note that we can't use std::unique_ptr

or raw_ptr::ClearAndDelete() because the destructor is private.

entry.title: Avoid dangling pointers in CreditCardFidoAuthenticator.
entry.content:
This CL addresses a dangling pointer that can occur outside of tests as

follows:

- CreditCardAccessManager owns a CreditCard and a

CreditCardFidoAuthenticator.

- CreditCardFidoAuthenticator stores a raw pointer to the CreditCard

when CreditCardFidoAuthenticator::Authenticate is called.

- CreditCardFidoAuthenticator owns a FullCardRequest, which, on

completion or failure, calls CreditCardFidoAuthenticator::OnFido*.

This, in turn, calls

CreditCardAccessManager::OnFIDOAuthenticationComplete, which calls

CreditCardAccessManager::Reset that deletes the CreditCard, to which

the CreditCardFidoAuthenticator still has a raw pointer.



This CL resolves this by keeping a copy of the CreditCard instead of

maintaining a pointer.



Bug: 1468967

Change-Id: Id1bdcfcc3430a663040cfad908316519870dbd71

entry.title: Hide Autofill Popup if hidden behind Pip window
entry.content:
crrev.com/c/3959939 introduced the logic to hide the autofill popup if

it is hidden behind the picture-in-picture window. This check was added

at the time of the autofill popup initialization.



However, picture-in-picture window can still hide the autofill popup

if picture-in-picture window is opened after a certain delay. This CL

prevents this by listening to the events sent by picture-in-picture

window and hiding the window when a picture-in-picture window is

to be presented.



See go/pip-autofill-security-bug for more details.



Bug: 1395164

entry.title: vaapi: Remove YUV422 workaround for AMD.
entry.content:
This CL removes a workaround that was introduced to get around the fact

that VA_RT_FORMAT_YUV422 used to not be reported as supported by

vaQueryConfigAttributes() for VAProfileJPEGBaseline decoding. Since

then, this seems to have been fixed upstream (b/128337341#comment20).



I have manually verified that YUV422 is still detected as supported in

grunt without the workaround.



Bug: b:128337341

entry.title: Make migrating snapshot more efficient
entry.content:
Migrating snapshot at launch had a catastrophic performance, as it

loaded all snapshots from disk into memory at once.



This CL prevents the round-trip through memory for unloaded images.

For those, it just moves the files on disk.



Before: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4ULRGdvVNAsKhja

After: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8nxjhQLjxkfjCCf

entry.title: Automatically annotate dangling ExperimentalAsh pointers [7/N]
entry.content:
This patch is:

- Automated. See [automation] section.

- Not affecting users, only Chrome's CQ. See [no-op] section.



This is a split affecting:

- chromeos/



Context:

--------

@bartekn is going to remove the `ExperimentalAsh` raw_ptr annotation.

This was a performance experiment to enable/disable MiraclePtr on a

subset of new pointers added for ChromeOS ash (non-lacros).



Before removing it, he needs to enable it by default in code. Enabling

MiraclePtr for them, causes the DanglingPointerDetector to be enforced.

To pass the CQ, we need to annotate pre-existing dangling pointer with

`DanglingUntriaged`. After enabling ExperimentalAsh feature, it won't be

allowed anymore for those pointers to become dangling.



Automation:

-----------

1. Enable the `PartitionAllocBackupRefPtrForAsh` feature flag.

2. Apply the 'annotator' CL: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4474553

3. Run all the gtests. See https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AMMERcqy0eafFWopUCHYsIKIKEp3J8DFxqW9UIbzIHo

4. Concatenate all the output_*, `filter`, `sort -nr`, `uniq`.

5. Run https://github.com/ArthurSonzogni/chrome-dangling-ptr-apply-edit

6. Run `git cl format`

7. Cherry-pick the patch created from (5)



no-op:

------

The DanglingPointerDetector is not enabled against users. It only

affects tests and chromium developers.

entry.title: Make track.getFrameStats() work when cloning or disabling the track.
entry.content:
When cloning a track, the stats counters should have a baseline of

zero. This is automatically true for `deliveredFrames` since frame

delivery counters are handled by MediaStreamVideoTrack already.



But this is not true of the video's source, since the same source can

be shared by multiple tracks cloned at multiple times or having been

enabled or disabled at different points in time.



In order to make track counters work as expected, each track gets its

own `baseline_discarded_frames_` and `baseline_dropped_frames_`

counters.



An alternative would be to move the frame counters to

MediaStreamTrackImpl, but that would require wiring up the

OnFrameDropped event further and I prefer to keep those counters on

the source level in case we want to refactor the threading assumptions

of OnFrameDropped (I would argue we do!).



Bug: chromium:1472978

entry.title: Automatically annotate dangling ExperimentalAsh pointers [1/N]
entry.content:
This patch is:

- Automated. See [automation] section.

- Not affecting users, only Chrome's CQ. See [no-op] section.



This is a split affecting:

- ui/



Context:

--------

@bartekn is going to remove the `ExperimentalAsh` raw_ptr annotation.

This was a performance experiment to enable/disable MiraclePtr on a

subset of new pointers added for ChromeOS ash (non-lacros).



Before removing it, he needs to enable it by default in code. Enabling

MiraclePtr for them, causes the DanglingPointerDetector to be enforced.

To pass the CQ, we need to annotate pre-existing dangling pointer with

`DanglingUntriaged`. After enabling ExperimentalAsh feature, it won't be

allowed anymore for the other pointers to become dangling anymore.



Automation:

-----------

1. Enable the `PartitionAllocBackupRefPtrForAsh` feature flag.

2. Apply the 'annotator' CL: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4474553

3. Run all the gtests. See https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AMMERcqy0eafFWopUCHYsIKIKEp3J8DFxqW9UIbzIHo

4. Concatenate all the output_*, `filter`, `sort -nr`, `uniq`.

5. Run https://github.com/ArthurSonzogni/chrome-dangling-ptr-apply-edit

6. Run `git cl format`

7. Cherry-pick the patch created from (5)



no-op:

------

The DanglingPointerDetector is not enabled against users. It only

affects tests and chromium developers.



Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chrome.try:chromeos-betty-pi-arc-chrome;luci.chrome.try:linux-chromeos-chrome

Bug: chromium:1441101

Change-Id: Iba0525a0e566fb7937a75f555e3972e2ddff087a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4775791

Commit-Queue: Arthur Sonzogni

Auto-Submit: Arthur Sonzogni

Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima

entry.title: [omnibox][ml] Don't score url-what-you-typed suggestions.
entry.content:
Scoring signals are not currently populated for url-what-you-typed

suggestions and are therefore not re-scored by the model. However, it's

possible that a duplicate suggestion with scoring signals gets merged

with the UWYT suggestion, causing it to be passed to the model. This can

result in the UWYT suggestion being artificially demoted.



This CL explicitly skips any UWYT type suggestion when passing the

potential matches to the model to be re-scored. It also records the

type of the match whose scoring signals are merged in additional_info.



Bug: 1405555

Change-Id: I554a85d3744c49457776bf93a75697cb6050e9f7

entry.title: inputs: Use enum to indicate connection mode for IME Service.
entry.content:
IME Service only allows at most one connection, to either:

- Decoder Engine: The code path used by the IME extension for VK and

Japanese PK.

- System Engine: The code path used by all other PK input methods.



When using the System Engine, the IME extension may still be running,

and may try to send messages to the Decoder Engine. To prevent this,

IME Service will not allow anyone to connect to the Decoder Engine

while connected to the System Engine. If a user switches from System

Engine to Decoder Engine, the System Engine connection must be

disconnected first, before connecting to the Decoder Engine.



However, there is a timing bug. Suppose the user is switching from

Chinese (System Engine) to Japanese (Decoder Engine). It is possible

that Japanese tries to connect to the Decoder Engine before Chinese has

finished destroying the System Engine. IME Service will erroneously

block Japanese from connecting.



To mitigate the timing issue, store an enum in IME Service that updates

ASAP when System Engine disconnects. Then, we can immediately connect to

the Decoder Engine without having to wait for System Engine to finish

cleanup (the Decoder Engine connection will block until System Engine

finishes clean up, instead of just being rejected completely).



There's still a potential timing issue where IME Service receives the

connection request before the disconnection request. However, this is

extremely unlikely.



We intend to resolve this issue completely in the future, by migrating

the IME extension to use modern JS Mojo bindings.



Bug: b/263184460

Change-Id: I0c7a55ca832f7ace2bee826f1be6058f2715e2b4

entry.title: Make destroying external delegate more natural in popup controller test.
entry.content:
Currently, the AutofillPopupController interactive UI test simulates

a deleted AutofillExternalDelegate by setting it to nullptr. This

creates a situation in which there is, e.g., still an AutofillDriver

and the driver factory has never issued a destruction event to its

observers, but the delegate is gone. This can never happen in

production code.



This CL makes the deleted delegate more realistic by triggering

its destruction via the ContentAutofillDriverFactory. This allows

production code that observes factory events to react to the deletion.

entry.title: Implement Revocation check with fallback CRL according to Feature flag and policy
entry.content:
Add feature flag and corresponding policy for fallback CRL to design

If there is no CRL provided, use fallback CRL instead when feature flag is enabled

if there is no fallback CRL throws Invalid Fallback CRL error

if revocation checked by fallback CRL is success, returns OK with Fallback CRL

if failed returns Error revocation with fallback crl



Design doc:go/cast-crl-fallback

entry.title: Add FetchResponseFrom::kSubresourceLoaderIsHandlingRedirect
entry.content:
This CL add the new enum value in

ServiceWorkerResourceLoader::FetchResponseFrom enum class.

Specifically, FetchResponseFrom::kSubresourceLoaderIsHandlingRedirect

which indicates the intermediate state when subresource loaders handle

redirect response. Since ServiceWorkerSubresourceLoader calls

StartRequest() multiple times when it handles redirections, the state of

the previous request is inherited.



Before this CL, we have a way to reset the state in

reset_commit_responsibility(). We use it when the redirect happens so

that the previous state is not inherited to the second request. However,

having a way to reset the state makes many corner cases being masked

behind exceptions, and introduces a lot of bidirectional state

transitions, which is not good.



This CL removes reset_commit_responsibility() and introduces the

intermediate state in FetchResponseFrom. This makes the state management

more unidirectional.



This CL doesn't change the behavior.

entry.title: Refactoring ServiceWorkerResourceLoader::SetCommitResponsibility()
entry.content:
A refactoring CL for SetCommitResponsibility(). This CL includes:



1) Use switch-case in SetCommitResponsibility to accept intermediate

states, which will be added in subsequent CLs.

2) Stop calling RecordFetchResponseFrom() from

SetCommitResponsibility(). After this CL, RecordFetchResponseFrom() is

called from the loader side. SetCommitResponsibility() will be called

multiple times, so it doesn't make sense to send UMA per the function

call.

3) Add CHECK to RecordFetchResponseFrom(). When this function is called,

commit_responsibility should be finalized.



This CL doesn't change behavior.

entry.title: [Promise Icons] Set Launcher promise app item position to sync ordinal
entry.content:
When a promise app item gets created for the Launcher, and its ID

matches an app in the sync data, set the promise app item’s Launcher

position to the StringOrdinal of the app in sync. This allows users who

sync apps across devices to see the promise app item in the place they

expect to see the fully installed app.

entry.title: Segmentation: Cache on demand segment results
entry.content:
The platform will cache last computed results for future usage. We may

introduce options in segmentation API later that can fetch cached

results if available for on demand segments.

entry.title: ozone/wayland: Use implicit sync interop on kernel >= 6.0 if explicit sync protocol is unavailable
entry.content:
This change allows Chromium to use the implicit sync interop

functionality present in Linux 6.0 and later to synchronize with Wayland

compositors lacking support for the

linux-explicit-synchronization-unstable-v1 protocol, allowing Vulkan to

be used with such compositors.



This is accomplished by using the

DMA_BUF_IOCTL_{IMPORT,EXPORT}_SYNC_FILE uAPIs introduced in Linux 6.0:

https://docs.kernel.org/driver-api/dma-buf.html#c.dma_buf_export_sync_file



More information about these kernel uAPIs can be found at

https://www.collabora.com/news-and-blog/blog/2022/06/09/bridging-the-synchronization-gap-on-linux/



Change-Id: Ie22cc8388570ba44a3e78640c15f511b7189a08e

Low-Coverage-Reason: runners using old kernel

entry.title: URL: Disallow a switch from a special scheme URL to a non-special scheme
entry.content:
The CL is a part of the URL Interop 2023.



Chrome currently allows setting a non-special scheme on a special

schema URL. This is not compliant with the URL standard.



Before this CL:



> const url = new URL("https://example.com/");

> url.protocol = "non-special";

> url.href

"non-special://example.com/"



After this CL:



> const url = new URL("https://example.com/");

> url.protocol = "non-special";

> url.href

"https://example.com/"



UMA [1] (Canary) is nearly 0%, so we can probably skip "Intent to Ship"

process, considering this is a bug fix.



[1] https://uma.googleplex.com/p/chrome/timeline_v2/?sid=a15c7dcb7c7442a06bd62f9007872d64



Bug: 1416018

Change-Id: Ibb496f2dc0c15e6579aab4a4b03e773b362dae4e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4744799

entry.title: [Extension] Emit a metric when service worker events are stale.
entry.content:
New metric:

Extensions.Events.DidDispatchToAckSucceed.ExtensionServiceWorker



This metrics measures if the renderer acknowledged the event to the

browser within a threshold of time (5 mins). "Stale" is if the event

is not acked within that time and the metric will emit "false".

Otherwise it will emit true.

entry.title: [Extensions] Add metrics for ProcessManager-triggered sw keepalives
entry.content:
Service worker-based extensions have keepalives triggered through the

ProcessManager notifying the ServiceWorkerContext of a started /

finished "external request". These notifications to the

ServiceWorkerContext can fail (e.g. if the worker isn't running).

Add metrics to track the result of the calls to notify the

ServiceWorkerContext.



Bug: 1441221

out of scope.

entry.title: Add skip_base_tests support to generated js tests
entry.content:
test.any.js shows up on the filesystem as one file but becomes

two tests: test.any.html and test.any.worker.html. For more info, see:

https://web-platform-tests.org/writing-tests/testharness.html. This

patch adds support for skipping the base tests when adding "test.any.js"

to skip_base_tests. Prior to this patch, the base version of these

tests would continue to run.

entry.title: Move servable_ etc. to PrefetchResponseReader
entry.content:
This CL further moves members needed for serving

from `PrefetchStreamingURLLoader` to

`PrefetchResponseReader`, as preparation to make

PrefetchContainer servable multiple times as long as

`PrefetchResponseReader` is alive.



This CL slightly changes the ordering

between setting `head_` and calling

`on_prefetch_response_started_callback_`

in `PrefetchStreamingURLLoader::OnReceiveResponse()`,

but this shouldn't affect the behavior because

the dependency between those two were removed by

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4671133.



Bug: 1449360

Change-Id: I4675153f240da0704aafe09eb807e443e41995bc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4671134
